raw_content: This paper presents work whose goal is to advance the field of Machine Learning. There are many potential societal consequences of our work, none which we feel must be specifically highlighted here.
The study investigates the impact of data quality on the performance of large language models.
This research introduces a novel architecture for multilingual machine translation.
Experimental results show that the proposed method significantly improves translation accuracy.
Our dataset consists of over 1 million aligned sentence pairs from diverse domains.
The model was trained using a combination of supervised and unsupervised learning techniques.
We evaluate the system on multiple benchmarks, including WMT and TED talks.
Future work includes exploring low-resource languages and domain adaptation strategies.
Ablation studies demonstrate the importance of each component in the translation pipeline.
Human evaluation confirms that our system produces more fluent and accurate translations.
The code and datasets are publicly available to facilitate reproducibility and further research.
